title: Cola fountains: a nucleation spectacular

options.label: D
options.text: A place where a CO2 molecule can be destroyed.

title: Pros and cons of public opinion polls - Jason Robert Jaffe

multiple-choice.question: What is the main problem with public opinion polls?

options.text: They are too expensive to conduct.

options.label: B
options.text: They are often inaccurate or misleading.

options.label: C
options.text: They are only conducted in certain regions.

options.label: D
options.text: They are only used by politicians.

multiple-choice.question: What is a sample in the context of public opinion polls?

options.label: A
options.text: A group of people who are asked to participate in a poll.

options.label: B
options.text: A type of question that is asked in a poll.

options.label: C
options.text: A way to analyze the results of a poll.

options.label: D
options.text: A method of conducting a poll.

options.text: Because it is too difficult to ask every person in the country.

options.label: B
options.text: Because the results will be too accurate.

options.label: C
options.text: Because the results will be less accurate.

options.label: A
options.text: The effect that the person asking the questions has on the sample.

options.label: B
options.text: The effect that the person being asked has on the sample.

options.label: C
options.text: The way the questions are worded.

multiple-choice.question: What is a push poll?

options.label: A
options.text: A type of question that is asked in a poll.

options.label: B
options.text: A way to analyze the results of a poll.

options.label: C
options.text: A poll that is conducted in a certain region.

options.label: D
options.text: A poll that is designed to influence the answer.

multiple-choice.question: Why are public opinion polls still prevalent despite their flaws?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they are too expensive to conduct.

options.label: B
options.text: Because they are only used by politicians.

options.label: C
options.text: Because they provide a sense of the thoughts and moods of large groups of people.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are only conducted in certain regions.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of a public opinion poll?

options.label: C
options.text: To provide a sense of the thoughts and moods of large groups of people.

multiple-choice.question: What is the problem with polls that are too narrow?

options.label: A
options.text: They are too expensive to conduct.

options.label: B
options.text: They are only conducted in certain regions.

options.label: C
options.text: They only ask a certain type of person a question.
